text:
"Recycling" replaced two earlier concepts: "salvage" and "scavenging." Salvage is what you do with materials that have significant economic value. Scavenging is what desperately poor people do.

Recycling is a way to get rich people to scavenge by pretending it's salvage.

text: As attempts at fake outrage go, this one is pretty lame.
author: Tracinski

text: Seriously, the SPLC literally lost a multimillion-dollar deflation suit for labeling a liberal Muslim reformer as an "anti-Muslim extremist." That seems relevant given how this thread started.
author: Tracinski

text: The SPLC is a cautionary tale here. They did a lot of that work, legally harassing white nationalist groups. Then then they ran low on real threats, they started branching out to labeling Christians and moderate Muslims as "hate groups."
author: Tracinski

text: I think part of the problem is that the work was done so well and so thoroughly that younger people don't even know it happened and can come along and say, "how come we're not doing anything to suppress white nationalist ideology?"
author: Tracinski

text: Coming back to this in the morning, let me offer one other observation. We actually have done a lot of what is being advocated here. From the 1960s through the 1990s, we dismantled white supremacy as a system of law and practically hounded the KKK out of existence.
author: Tracinski

text: And to @mattwridley specifically I would add one more reason not to overreact: because the world is not coming to an end. Is white nationalism stronger now than it was during the era of Jim Crow and the KKK? During Apartheid? One horrible event is not reason for panic.

text:
Her campaign slogan was "Ready for Hillary." You can't avoid this.

Look, it's not necessarily a negative thing. It can be a "brand." Being known by just one name or an acronym ("AOC") confers a certain cache, which is another reason I avoid it in my formal writing.
